attributes.title: Dasani Bottled Water
attributes.description:
Created on November 15, 2010 by VictoriaEdwards on Sourcemap.org:

Dasani bottled water is made by Coca-Cola, and comes from city water supplies across the U.S.  It is estimated there are 30 different water supply sites used across the country.  Swire Coca-Cola, USA is the fifth largest Coca-Cola bottler in the United States, and distributes to 11 different western states.  There are two sites in the west where Dasani water is bottled-  Salt Lake City, Utah and Fruitland, Idaho.

attributes.name: Dasani Bottled Water
attributes.title: Dasani Bottled Water
attributes.description: Dasani bottled water is made by Coca-Cola, and comes from city water supplies across the U.S.  It is estimated there are 30 different water supply sites used across the country.  Swire Coca-Cola, USA is the fifth largest Coca-Cola bottler in the United States, and distributes to 11 different western states.  There are two sites in the west where Dasani water is bottled-  Salt Lake City, Utah and Fruitland, Idaho.

attributes.name: Water
attributes.title: Water
attributes.description: Water is collected from Salt Lake City's municipal water supply.  It is then piped to the bottling plant nearby.

attributes.name: Bonneville Production Center of Utah
attributes.title: Bonneville Production Center of Utah
attributes.description: One of two production centers owned by Swire Coca-Cola, the water is bottled here and then sent to distribution offices in the surrounding area.

attributes.name: Bonneville Production Center of Idaho
attributes.title: Bonneville Production Center of Idaho
attributes.description: One of two production centers owned by Swire Coca-Cola, the water is bottled here and then sent to distribution offices in the surrounding area.

attributes.name: Swire Coca-Cola Bottling Co.
attributes.title: Swire Coca-Cola Bottling Co.
attributes.description: One of 27 distribution offices owned by Swire Coca-Cola, from here the Dasani water will be delivered to grocery stores, gas stations, and vending machines
